heading: ex-cowboy dies
subheading: mark tuinei, who played on a dallas cowboys team that won three super bowls in the early '90s, died early thursday after being found unconscious in his car. he was 39. investigators said they found no evidence of foul play, drugs, or alcohol. tuinei, a 6-foot-5, 320-pound left tackle, played 15 seasons with the cowboys, blocking for quarterback troy aikman and opening holes for running back emmitt smith. he and his wife, pono, were getting ready to return to their native hawaii, where tuinei had taken a job as offensive line coach at his old high school, punahou, in honolulu.
author: wired staff
text: mark tuinei, who played on a dallas cowboys team that won three super bowls in the early '90s, died early thursday after being found unconscious in his car. he was 39. investigators said they found no evidence of foul play, drugs, or alcohol. tuinei, a 6-foot-5, 320-pound left tackle, played 15 seasons with the cowboys, blocking for quarterback troy aikman and opening holes for running back emmitt smith. he and his wife, pono, were getting ready to return to their native hawaii, where tuinei had taken a job as offensive line coach at his old high school, punahou, in honolulu.
